alert.note: Alert for Lipscomb; Ochiltree (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 03 at 6:12AM CDT until June 04 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Amarillo TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... Wolf Creek at Lipscomb affecting Ochiltree and Lipscomb Counties. For the Wolf Creek...including Lipscomb...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wolf Creek at Lipscomb. * WHEN...From this morning to just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 9.5 feet, Glen Turner Memorial Park at Lipscomb will begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:45 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 9.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:45 AM CDT Saturday was 9.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this afternoon and continue falling to 6.5 feet early Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 9.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.1 feet on 03/29/2007. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this morning at 1100 AM CDT.
